_____ mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.
This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.
Violent conflicts erupt between _____ and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.
It’s accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. _____ keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.
It leads a group of Pawniard. _____ doesn’t even change its expression when it deals the finishing blow to an opponent.
No matter how strong the _____, it’s said that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will retire from its position as the boss.
_____ pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then _____ finishes off the prey.
This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.
